title: India's envoy to US outlines AI goals, says focus on adoption across ecosystem
description: WASHINGTON, Oct 19:  India’s Ambassador to the United States, Vinay Mohan Kwatra, has said that India’s artificial intelligence (AI) strategy is centred on promoting the development, diffusion and adoption of the technology across its entire ecosystem.   In a social media post, the envoy stated that he participated in a roundtable on the theme ‘AI Sprinters: AI Works for Governments,’ hosted by the Atlantic Council think tank, where he outlined India’s strategic priorities in AI. Speaking at the discussion, Kwatra […]
content:

Daily Excelsior
-

title: Artificial intelligence threatening to push young people out of entry-level jobs
description: OTTAWA — Throughout her university career, Jacqueline Silver assumed her computer science degree would guarantee her a job. Finding out she was wrong was a demoralizing experience.
content:
OTTAWA — Throughout her university career, Jacqueline Silver assumed her computer science degree would guarantee her a job. Finding out she was wrong was a demoralizing experience.

title: Google shifts SC into AI’s fast lane with a $9B investment
description: Google announced Oct. 13 it will invest $9 billion in South Carolina under an accelerated 2-year schedule to handle skyrocketing demand tied to the rapidly growing artificial-intelligence boom.
content:
The road from South Carolina to the one-time “information superhighway” is being resurfaced into an AI autobahn.
And the big-ticket, high-stakes upgrade is picking up speed.
Google moved into the fast lane last week. The internet giant announced it w... [4562 chars]

title: BFSI, retail and manufacturing to drive Salesforce growth in India: CEO Arundhati Bhattacharya
description: Salesforce India expects robust growth in the coming three years. Key sectors like BFSI, retail, and manufacturing will drive this expansion. The company is also witnessing a strong push towards Artificial Intelligence adoption across industries. Salesforce has introduced Agentforce IT Service to enhance IT support efficiency.
content:
Synopsis

title: Hideo Kojima Sees Creating Together with AI as the Way to Stay One Step Ahead in the Future
description: Hideo Kojima described artificial intelligence (AI) as a 'friend' in game creation with which he will stay one step ahead in the future.
content: In a brief Instagram reel posted by Wired Japan (and spotted by Culture Crave) following a visit to Kojima Productions in Tokyo, Hideo Kojima shared his thoughts on how to use AI during game creation. The renowned game designer behind the Metal Gear ... [1700 chars]

title: BFSI, retail and manufacturing to drive Salesforce growth in India: Arundhati Bhattacharya
description: She retired from SBI in 2017 and went on to reinvent herself with a brand new career innings at the helm of cloud-based service provider Salesforce India in 2020 as Chairperson and CEO.Since then, under her leadership, Salesforce India operation has seen multi-fold jump both in terms of revenue and headcount.Speaking about AI adoption by Indian banks, Bhattacharya said every single company in its board conversations earlier used to talk digitization but now is talking adoption of Artificial Intelligence AI.Where they will make the most use of it in order to get the best returns is probably the concern.
content:
BFSI, retail and manufacturing to drive the US-based IT firm Salesforce's growth in India over the next three years, a top executive of the company said.
''The three-year agenda remains more or less the same. We still see a lot of growth coming out o... [3725 chars]

title: HDFC Bank doesn't see AI leading to layoffs: CEO
description: MUMBAI, Oct 19:  The country’s largest private sector lender HDFC Bank does not see its use of artificial intelligence leading to any layoffs, a top company official has said.   The lender, which had 2.20 lakh employees as of September, is carrying out some “lighthouse experiments” in technologies, including generative AI, which will deliver its advantages in the next 18-24 months, HDFC Bank Chief Executive and Managing Director Sashidhar Jagdishan said on Saturday. “Frankly, AI is not going (to result […]
content:

title: HDFC Bank doesn't see AI leading to layoffs: CEO
description: HDFC Bank sees artificial intelligence as an opportunity, not a threat to jobs. The bank's chief executive Sashidhar Jagdishan believes AI will help redeploy staff from backend operations to customer-facing roles. This strategic shift aims to enhance customer engagement and innovation. HDFC Bank is conducting experiments with generative AI, expecting benefits in the next 18 to 24 months.
content:

title: HDFC Bank doesn't see AI leading to layoffs: CEO
description: The countrys largest private sector lender HDFC Bank does not see its use of artificial intelligence leading to any layoffs, a top company official has said.The lender, which had 2.20 lakh employees as of September, is carrying out some lighthouse experiments in technologies, including generative AI, which will deliver its advantages in the next 18-24 months, HDFC Bank Chief Executive and Managing Director Sashidhar Jagdishan said on Saturday.Frankly, AI is not going to result in any layoff whatsoever in our bank, at least.
content:
